column4: problem with ubuntu 9.10 64-bit on laptop: dual boot with vista, starts up fine, however, 2 major problems: first: can not install any program (not by using the ubuntu program installer - forgot the exact name) it always says about EVERY program that there is no package available, also downloading the setup file and then tryong to install it also does not work. this goes for any application that i am trying to install
since i am noob: have read about 32 and 64-bit OS, but why can i not install anything? is it a glitch in the 64-bit OS?
i have not encountered similar problems on the forums :(
make sure that universe and multiverse repositories are enabled in the software sources
